title: Prefigurative Community Building (Part 2): 40 Projects to Start Building the New World
summary: We don't need permission to begin. We need each other. Here are 40 practical projects you can start or join to build Power With instead of Power Over, from community gardens to tool libraries to mutual aid networks.

Food.summary: Build food sovereignty through collective cultivation and sharing.

level0: Start a free fridge or pantry in your neighborhood
Join a local foraging walk or wildcrafting group
level1: Organize a community garden or guerrilla gardening project
Start neighborhood food circles or meal shares
level2: Help establish a food co-op in your area
level3: Coordinate multiple food projects across neighborhoods

Community.summary: Create infrastructure for care, housing, and mutual support.

level0: Start a childcare or elder care collective
level1: Organize tool libraries or seed libraries
level2: Establish housing cooperatives or tenant unions

Knowledge.summary: Share skills and create alternative education systems.

level0: Join or start radical study groups
Participate in repair caf√©s or fix-it clinics
level1: Create makerspaces oriented toward community resilience
level2: Start liberation schools or alternative education
level3: Create educational infrastructure for movement building

Power.summary: Build collective power through horizontal organizing and defense.

level0: Learn digital security and help others protect their data
level1: Train as street medic for protests and emergencies

Money.summary: Create alternative economies based on cooperation rather than extraction.

level0: Join local currency or mutual credit networks
level1: Organize clothing swaps and non-monetary exchanges

Communication.summary: Create independent media and storytelling infrastructure.

level0: Join zine collectives or community media platforms
level3: Create comprehensive narrative and communication networks

Narrative.summary: Shift from Power Over to Power With through lived experience of alternatives.

level0: Practice consensus decision-making in small groups
level1: Help others understand Power With vs Power Over
level2: Build culture of cooperation and mutual aid
level3: Create widespread culture shift toward collaboration
Establish prefigurative politics as dominant practice
